image.altText: A shot of a baby, taken from above, as he lays in his mum's arms.

props.synopsis: As an exhausted first-time mum, Galen Elliott says she felt "like her world exploded" when she was told there was a potential problem with her newborn.

title.children: 'It's a controversial topic': Navigating the complexity of tongue-ties as a first-time mum

image.altText: A Palestinian child sits on top of a pile of matresses on a road.

props.synopsis: The United Nations adds Israel's armed and security forces, Hamas and the Palestinian Islamic Jihad militant group along with the Sudanese Armed Forces and rival paramilitary group Rapid Support Forces for the first time to its list of offenders for violating children's rights.

title.children: Israel's armed forces and Hamas are now on a UN global list of offenders that harm children

image.altText: Leeanne Eatts walks past a camera wearing reflective sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A mother found guilty of manslaughter over the drowning deaths of her two "defenceless and vulnerable" young sons is sentenced to eight years' jail.

title.children: Mother sentenced to jail for sons' drowning deaths told she 'failed her duty as a parent'

image.altText: A hand wearing a blue rubber glove holding a small tin full of pouches.

props.synopsis: Nicotine pouches are illegal in Australia, but they've been seized in alarming quantities since the federal government's ban on single-use vapes. Here's why the small sachets have authorities worried.

title.children: Are nicotine pouches the next vape? Authorities warn Australia is being flooded with them

image.altText: A photo collage

props.synopsis: One photojournalist follows the lives of Warumungu traditional owners in Jurnkkurakurr (Tennant Creek) as they detail their ambitious way out of a centuries-long housing crisis.

title.children: Overcrowding and 'heat caves' plague these communities. They're now bringing home back to Country

image.altText: An iPhone shows various apps against a black background.

props.synopsis: There are growing calls for a ban on children accessing social media, with support on both sides of politics, but experts are divided.

title.children: Social media age limits might be popular with politicians and parents, but experts warn they aren't simple

image.altText: Benjamin Netanyahu graphic

props.synopsis: The evidence suggests the Greens' claims of a "two-way arms trade" between Australia and Israel is in fact one-way, with Australia importing but not exporting lethal technology from Israel.

title.children: Is Australia sending arms to Israel? No, but imports of Israeli weapons continue

image.altText: Four women stand in coats and winter jackets outside on a sunny day in a city setting. Three are wearing facemasks

props.synopsis: Women in Japan face a $4,800 fine if they have a sterilisation procedure without their spouse's consent, but there is now a fight to have that changed.

title.children: These women want to be sterilised — they have to fight the law, their country, family and history

image.altText: A grainy photo of Maria James, sitting next to her young son and holding a sleeping baby in her arms.

props.synopsis: Police say even a small detail could be the missing piece in the puzzle of who killed Melbourne mother Maria James in her book store in 1980.

title.children: Four decades after Melbourne mother Maria James was found brutally murdered, police offer $1 million reward

image.altText: A woman looks down on her work documents with a frown

props.synopsis: Going for a run, socialising, and learning a new hobby – a new research study aims to find out how Australians are recovering from their daily work stresses.

title.children: 'People are more exhausted than ever': New research aims to find out how Australians are recovering from work

image.altText: Boxes of Mifeprisone tablets are stacked on top of each other on a shelf

props.synopsis: The unanimous decision is the first on abortion since Supreme Court justices overturned Roe vs Wade.

title.children: US Supreme Court strikes out bid to restrict access to abortion pill

image.altText: Signs on a fence opposing the pumped hydro plans

props.synopsis: David Crisafulli says the LNP will not proceed with a proposed pumped hydro project in north Queensland, labelling it "unachievable" and a "thought bubble".

title.children: 'Massive cost blowouts': Queensland opposition to ditch pumped hydro project if elected

image.altText: A composite image shows a man singing into a microphone, a female athlete looking shocked, and an older man presenting onstage.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: New life for punk legends, a race walking upset, and Apple gets in the AI game

image.altText: A middle-aged man sitting on a sea rockwall with a beautiful mountain in the background by the ocean.

props.synopsis: Their decision to jump into the water with a southern right whale made international headlines, but the "thrilling" experience came at a cost.

title.children: Thirty years ago, this surfer and his friend swam with a whale. It thrust them into the middle of a landmark court case

image.altText: A graphic of a mosque silhouette against a light blue background with moon and stars.

props.synopsis: This weekend is a big one in the Islamic calender, with Eid al-Adha celebrations planned across the country.

title.children: When is Eid al-Adha this year?

image.altText: Image of hundreds of sheep being held in an open air shed, waiting for export.

props.synopsis: After a Canberra hearing heard from animal activists and industry leaders, WA farmers impacted by the proposed ban will have their say in Northam.

title.children: Politicians warned to expect anger as live sheep export hearing begins in WA

image.altText: A man holding a beer wearing a flower hat

props.synopsis: Seven women read their victim impact statements out in court after Andrew Thomas Hayler uploaded digitally altered photographs of them to sexually explicit websites.

title.children: Close friend of bartender whose photos he manipulated for sexually graphic websites speaks of 'shock'

image.altText: A courtroom sketch of Greg Lynn

props.synopsis: Judge Michael Croucher tells the jury that the only charges to be considered are the alleged murders of two Victorian campers, Carol Clay and Russell Hill.

title.children: Judge says deaths of Carol Clay and Russell Hill cannot be ruled manslaughter in Greg Lynn trial

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: A study ranking nearly 100 cities in eight countries places Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide and Perth among the world's least affordable cities to buy a home.

title.children: Housing is 'impossibly unaffordable' in Sydney, Melbourne and Adelaide, and 'severely unaffordable' elsewhere

image.altText: A cream house with a small yard.  A sign in the yard says it is against heritage protections.

props.synopsis: The residents of War Workers Housing Estate in Moorooka have been fighting a temporary heritage listing that was placed over 180 homes in 2022, while council worked to make the overlay permanent.

title.children: Over $20m in value stripped from homes in Brisbane estate after 'unprecedented' heritage listing introduced

image.altText: Nicho Hynes looks upset after the Sharks' NRL loss to the Dolphins.

props.synopsis: Nicho Hynes faces a nervous wait to see if he keeps the Blues' number seven jersey for State of Origin II after the Sharks fall to the Dolphins in a 30-28 defeat.

title.children: Hynes's NSW Origin hopes take a hit after Sharks' loss to Dolphins

image.altText: Kyle Chalmers holds his hands on his head and smiles

props.synopsis: Olympic champion sprinter Kyle Chalmers reveals he is battling a degenerative back issue as he plots his path to another gold medal in Paris, while Kaylee McKeown falls agonisingly short of breaking her own world record in the women's 200m backstroke.

title.children: Chalmers overcomes back injury to punch Paris ticket, McKeown tunes up for backstroke showdown

image.altText: Presenter Paul Barry

props.synopsis: The show's longest-serving host will finish up in December this year.

title.children: Paul Barry steps away from Media Watch after 11 years as host

image.altText: Melbourne chiropractor Ian Rossborough cracks a baby's back

props.synopsis: Doctors says the return of chiropractic practices on children is "deeply disturbing", after outcry over the practice led to an interim ban in 2019.

title.children: 'A shiver goes down my spine': Doctors group condemns return of practice of manipulating babies' spines

image.altText: A sign for a community meeting is posted on a fence.

props.synopsis: A new report finds that by 2030, more than 3 million Australian homes could have exposure to some level of riverine flooding and it could leave home owners in precarious financial positions.

title.children: Thought it was already hard to get a mortgage? New flood modelling is expected to make that even worse

image.altText: a woman looking ahead and talking

props.synopsis: Chris Dawson is serving a maximum 24-year jail sentence for the murder of his first wife, Lynette Simms, more than four decades ago.

title.children: Chris Dawson loses appeal over conviction for murdering wife Lynette Simms in the 1980s

image.altText: Teal PMs Allegra Spender, Monique Ryan, Sophie Scamps, Kylea Tink, Kate Chaney and Zali Steggall at a press conference

props.synopsis: Peter Dutton is taking a gamble that people are more worried about paying their bills than solving the climate crisis. It's high-stakes poker, in which he hopes his plan can flush out the teals and win back Liberal votes.

title.children: Some say Dutton's high-stakes gamble has cleared the way for another teal wave, but he's betting on a different outcome

image.altText: A photo of saltwater crocodile is moved into police UTE.

props.synopsis: A saltwater crocodile almost 4 metres long seen stalking residents and dogs in the remote Northern Territory has been removed from a waterway in the territory's west.

title.children: 'A few full bellies': Large saltwater croc shot in Top End river, cooked in community feast

image.altText: A wide elevated image of a city centre intersection in Cairns

props.synopsis: Cairns needs tens of millions of dollars to shore up its security of drinking water, but advocates say the city also needs to look at ways to reduce the amount of water being used.

title.children: Drinking water security and efficiency in spotlight in Cairns, despite high rainfall, as supply shortfall looms

image.altText: Bec Bulley opens her mouth and throws her hands out in frustration while watching a Super Netball game

props.synopsis: A dressing-room mutiny has resulted in coach Bec Bulley leaving the struggling Queensland Firebirds despite more than two years remaining on her contract.

title.children: Bec Bulley and Firebirds part ways after player revolt

image.altText: An injured Queensland State of Origin stands around his teammates after a game.

props.synopsis: Brisbane coach Kevin Walters says Reece Walsh is making good progress with concussion protocols and will be fit for Queensland in game two of State of Origin.

title.children: 'Billy will select him': Kevin Walters says Reece Walsh on track for Origin

image.altText: An illustration of a winged creature that lived during the time of the dinosaurs

props.synopsis: Fossilised remains thought to be 100 million years old have been identified as a new species of pterosaur, a powerful flying predator with a wingspan of up to 12 metres.

title.children: Outback fossil find confirms giant 'demonic pelicans' filled Australia's skies 100 million years ago

image.altText: Catherine Laga'aia

props.synopsis: Sydney teenager Catherine Laga'aia has been cast as Moana in a live-action remake of the Disney film. Laga'aia says she's excited and honoured to "represent young girls who look like me".

title.children: Who is the Australian teenager cast in the live-action Moana?
